Headline: Founder @Wild Oak | Building D2C Body-Care Brand | Carlson MBA‚Äô17 | Ex-Product & Strategy
Comment:
Completely agree on the customer experience and long term potential - no doubt Lenskart is building something strong. But valuation isn‚Äôt about whether they‚Äôll grow or has great customer experience. It‚Äôs about how much of that growth is already priced in. 

How far into the future has the market already factored their growth? 5 years, 10, or 20?

When you invest as a VC in startups at very early stage, there is a chance revenues / profits can grow 10X, 100X even then they are not valued at 10X revenue normally. 

Just my opinion.
